description: The NTE segment is defined here for inclusion in messages defined in other chapters. It is commonly used for sending notes and comments.

fields.name: Set ID - NTE
fields.description: This field may be used where multiple NTE segments are included in a message. Their numbering must be described in the application message definition.

fields.name: Source of Comment
fields.description: This field is used when source of comment must be identified. This table may be extended locally during implementation. Refer to HL7 Table 0105 - Source of comment for valid values.

fields.name: Comment
fields.description:
This field contains the comment contained in the segment.

Note: As of v2.2, this field uses the FT rather than a TX data type. Since there is no difference between an FT data type without any embedded formatting commands, and a TX data type, this change is compatible with the previous version.

fields.name: Comment Type
fields.description:
This field contains a value to identify the type of comment text being sent in the specific comment record. Refer to User-Defined Table 0364 - Comment Type for suggested values.

Note: A field already exists on the NTE record that identifies the Sources of Comment (e.g., ancillary, placer, other). However some applications need to support other types of comment text (e.g., instructions, reason, remarks, etc.). A separate NTE segment can be used for each type of comment (e.g., instructions are on one NTE and remarks on another NTE)

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.
